intro: Mussaenda soyauxii, commonly known as the golden flame bush, is a deciduous shrub native to Madagascar. It belongs to the Rubiaceae family and is characterized by its showy, tubular yellow flowers that bloom in clusters. The plant has opposite, elliptical leaves with a smooth surface and a slightly waxy texture. It thrives in full sun to partial shade and prefers well-drained, sandy soils. Mussaenda soyauxii is often cultivated for its ornamental value in gardens and landscapes.
